intro: Hieracium rigescens, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, rough to the touch, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, producing a striking visual display during the summer months.
